outputs.output_descr:
"Phase II of the GPAR Luang-Prabang Project will build on the achievements of the first phase and move towards harnessing governance and public administration reforms to promote economic growth and poverty reduction in the province. The project will seek to strengthen provincial ownership and management of the public administration reform agenda and continue to facilitate flows of information about local GPAR activities, intended both to inform national policy and other provincial pilots.

The project will deliver a number of key outputs: Output 1. Strengthened decentralized administration and expenditure management of pro-poor services  Output 2. Public service delivery reforms in health and education sectors Output 3. Business Facilitation Centre  providing an enabling environment for business activities in Luang-Prabang district Output 4. Provincial oversight mechanism (POM) for Office of the Governor to oversee administration and public services, and strengthen people's participation in administration Output 5. GPAR Support Facility which funds wide range of small GPAR initiatives in province and block grants for districts Output 6. GPAR Resource Centre through which GPAR learning mechanisms are established and strengthened Output 7. Project support

The proposed timeframe for the second phase is four years to 2010.
"

project_descr: Governance and Public Administration Reform  Luang Prabang Phase II
project_title: GPAR Luang Prabang Phase II: Improving Service Delivery
